message:
IIT Kharagpur alumni have developed a social network for food lovers called Eatable. Eatable help you to connect with fellow foodies and post a review or suggestion about eateries. Eatable work on both mobile and desktop and is accessible all over India.
It gives a direct relationship between foodies and their place of preference since even eateries can post content themselves and their followers are notified in real time.   

http://indiatoday.intoday.in/education/story/iit-kharagpur-social-network-food-lovers/1/1057092.html

﻿Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur in its pursuit of constructing safe and sustainable future-technologies has recently come up with a solution to check the hacking into IoT devices.  IoT is a rapid-expanding segment of AI but security concerns have caused some issues with its implementation. IIT Kharagpur always a precursor in the prudent implementation of technology has come up with a solution to mitigate the concerns of manufacturers and consumers alike.

http://tech.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/technology/iit-kgp-develops-solution-to-check-hacking-into-iot-devices/60789736

IIT Kharagpur students have bagged myriads of PPO’s from worldwide renowned companies that include names like Goldman Sach’s, Qualcomm, Texas. It is the first time that the institute has received such an overwhelming response of around 200 international companies offering internships to its students. Students of KGP opting for Foreign Training programmes during summer recess has seemed to catalyse such a response. Their hard work and dedication have been recognized and appreciated by international companies. They are pleased to come to KGP and get hold of these dedicated, sincere souls. Do give a read of the link below to know the entire scenario of these PPO’s.

http://www.financialexpress.com/education-2/iit-kharagpur-placements-in-a-first-students-get-over-200-offers-from-top-mncs/853845/

IIT Kharagpur in its mission to provide alternate and better energy sources for India for a sustainable future has come up with a microbial fuel cell that can be made using commonly accessible components. The 'bio-cell' can be made using very simple and economical materials like filter paper, eyeliner, organic fuel and some bacteria.

https://researchmatters.in/shots/how-build-battery-eyeliner-some-bacteria-and-filter-paper

story: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared their post.
message: Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared their post. The Young Innovators' Program (YIP) organized for the first time by IIT Kharagpur received a fervent response from students from all over India. YIP aims at kindling the fire of innovation in students of 8th, 9th and 10th standard. The initial round saw a pan India participation of 250 teams or 600 students and 60 of them are contesting in the second round, which is synopsis submission.The teams selected for the third round will have a chance to visit IIT Kharagpur and display their idea in presence of distinguished researchers. To know in details, give a read of the link below. http://www.millenniumpost.in/kolkata/iit-kgp-organises-competition-on-technology-ideation-260950

This year India is witnessing the first of its kind a PAN India competition organized by the most dynamic IIT of India. IIT Kharagpur has launched Young Innovators’ Program(YIP) for the 8th, 9th and 10th class students. The institute wants to engage the students in analysing real life problems and find solutions for the same. YIP is an effort to produce this outcome. Schools all over India have responded positively to this competition. Around 600 registrations and synopsis submissions have been witnessed. YIP consists of 4 rounds. Presently, 60 teams are contesting in the 2nd round to secure their place in the upcoming rounds which are scheduled at IIT Kharagpur. To know in details, do give a read of the link below.

http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/iit-students-launch-young-innovators-prog-for-school-students/1/1042356.html

IIT Kharagpur has yet again come forward to help the society. As always, it has developed a technology for the safety of commuters during foggy, rainy days. KGP researchers have come up with a solution to obscure road view to drivers during bad weather. Detection of nearby objects would become easier with this visual technology that removes rain from real time videos. Do give a read of the link below to know the details of the technology developed.

https://yourstory.com/2017/09/iit-kharagpur-indian-railways-rain/

Knowledge should be free and available to everybody. Keeping this ideology in mind IIT Kharagpur is building enthusiastically and extensively one of the largest digital libraries "National Digital Library of India" under the guidance of MHRD.
You can access this vast resource of knowledge by registering yourself at NDL portal.
National Digital Library of India

Digitized medium is what students can relate to today. Internet has become the hub of video lectures, notes and educational pdf documents. Students hardly feel the urge to take the heavy books down from the shelves and do the effort to read it. We have soft copies of everything. The government of India is wise enough to promote this attitude. It has called upon the heads of all universities to get their library stuff digitised. National Digital Library is supposed to host the digitised study materials on its page. Do give a read of the link below to know how IIT Kharagpur is involved in this effort.
http://www.deccanherald.com/content/629779/govt-asks-varsities-digitise-books.html

Hello! 

Greetings from The Finance & Investment Cell, St. Stephen's College.​!

The Finance & Investment Cell of St. Stephen's College is proud to present and invite you to it's unique and exciting case solving competition, CASE CLUB LEAGUE.

We would like to invite your college to take part in one of the most prestigious case solving competitions. Please do circulate the same to the students in your college!

The Case Club League is going to land you up in tough situations and throw challenges at you that will take meticulous thinking and test your ability to resolve issues, negotiate and outsmart some of the best in the business.

A brief overview of the structure of the competition is as follows:

Participation in teams up to 3 members (lone wolves are allowed). Cross- college teams are allowed. Students from colleges outside Delhi University can also participate.

It comprises of three rounds. The first round will be online, focusing on interactive corporate case studies and held over two days, 11th and 12thAugust.

Slots for participation are:
11th August (online): 6 PM to 9 PM
12th August (online): 10 PM to 1 AM

The second round will also be online and the third round will be held at St. Stephen’s College. The second round will be based on excel modelling where you will be tested on your creativity and innovation, while the third round will be a surprise round. We will make changes in the final round for the outstation teams who make it to the finals.

With some exciting prizes at stake, this year's edition is all set to be bigger and better! Come try the first ever midnight interactive case study competition at Delhi University!

REGISTER NOW (deadline 10th August): http://tinyurl.com/caseclubleague17

For more information, keep checking our Facebook page :-
https://www.facebook.com/events/1928409410771095/?ti=as

In case of any  queries contact:

Pragati : +91-9538767691
Naren : +91-9997980999
Muskan : +91-9205741198

Or mail us at caseclubleague2017.ssc@gmail.com

Regards
The Case Club League Team
(F&IC, St. Stephen's College)

Entrepreneurship has always been a pillar of strength for IIT Kharagpur. A lot of startups have been blooming recently from the grounds of IIT Kharagpur. With the collective efforts of STEP, Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur and Rajendra Mishra School of Engineering Entrepreneurship, IIT Kharagpur our students have been excellent in the Entrepreneurial field
Give the article by Anish Moonka a read to get more insights about Entrepreneurship and IIT Kharagpur

IIT Kharagpur with a motive to foster scientific creativity and enthusiasm amongst the school children, declares the first edition of Young Innovators' Program organized by Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur. Young Innovators' Program-2017 welcomes student from classes 8, 9 and 10 to come up with scientific solutions to the current global problems in the given themes. Organised in 4 rounds, 30 best teams will get an opportunity to present their ideation at IIT Kharagpur. 

Explore the website to know more: www.barciitkgp.com

We strongly hope for success in guiding them to take one of the most important decisions of their life in the best way.

Deakin University and Coventry University is jointly offering a PhD scholarship (Co-tutelle) on the topic of ‘Repair of Superalloy Components by Laser Engineered Net Shaping’
We are inviting students who have recently completed their Master’s program in Materials or Metallurgical engineering with the following essential eligibility criteria –
• First Class scores of above 80% in the final exams at Graduation and Post-Graduation level.
• Candidates with publications are preferred
• IELTS (Overall 6.5 with no band less than 6)
Interested candidates can send CV & research proposal to Ms. Ruby Majumdar at ruby.majumdar@deakin.edu.au before 10th May 2017.

Deakin University, Australia is offering fully funded On Campus PhD positions in the area of Data Analytics/Machine Learning at the Centre of Pattern Recognition and Data Analytics (PRaDA). The eligibility criteria is –
• Graduates preferred from the area of Maths/Stats/Electrical/Machine Learning/Computer Science 
• Candidates with 80% in both UG and PG level will be preferred
• Mandatory IELTS scores required (Band 6.5/6)
Please send updated CV & research proposal to Ms. Ruby Majumdar at ruby.majumdar@deakin.edu.au by 10th May 2017.
